pullRequest.title: [bluetooth] Add support for devices jumping between adapters.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Implements and closes #7008
This PR basically adds support for a virtual bluetooth adapter (what I call a roaming adapter) that allows handlers to interact with a virtual BluetoothDevice that delegates all its operations to actual BluetoothDevice instances on actual adapters. The virtual adapter will always delegate to the nearest actual adapter for a given bluetooth device.
The primary purpose of this new feature is presence detection. If a user places bluetooth adapters all of the house they can identify which room a particular bluetooth device is in at any time.
This is one of the features that I'm trying to replicate from the 3rd party bluetooth binding.

Refactored the roaming adapter into its own binding.

Signed-off-by: Connor Petty <mistercpp2000+gitsignoff@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: To me as a reader it is completely unclear what this "Location" string will contain. Would be nice to have some better explanation for it.

@@ -0,0 +1,41 @@
+# Bluetooth Roaming Adapter
+
+This extension adds support for accessing Bluetooth devices from any other configured adapter via a virtual adapter.
+
+## Supported Things
+
+It defines the following bridge type:

+| Bridge Type ID | Description                                                                                                |
+|----------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
+| roaming        | A virtual Bluetooth adapter that interacts with Bluetooth devices through their nearest Bluetooth adapter. |
